@Ranxerox: You download them. Then they (all the data.json files) get merged into one sql database locally that you query from.

@P2P: Yes, but using pip isn't actually that hard. It's just a .txt file with a list of dependencies.
On the other hand: All the other issues he mentioned are not that obvious.
@P2P: Why not bundle the stuff pip downloads into the bundle / update server?
@P2P: The users would have to run pip themselves, but we could pack all the stuff pip downloads with the updates. So it isn't stored in git anymore but still distributed with zeronet.
@P2P: I don't know. The only difference would be that the lib folder does not exist anymore
Pure madness.
@Yinyue: You're right GFW is way worse than Russia's censorship. But it's still important to know whether (more like when) Russia will have the next GFW.
Horrible

> This implies the only available way to do personal computing today, is to destroy your expensive laptop and run ZeroNet on your GBA.

:D

And then there is also that ubuntu-mirror (all ubuntu xenial, yakkety and zesty amd64 packages) I have. And the various blockchains I have downloaded (namecoin, dogecoin, still not enough space for bitcoin - 100gb, byteball, etherum)
So russia is the new north korea. Turkey is the new russia. And north korea is the hell on earth.
